message_1:
A company wants to analyze the performance of their employees based on their sales record. The sales data is given in the form of an 8x5 matrix, where each row represents a different employee and each column represents a different product category. The company wants to reduce the dimensionality of the data using Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and identify the component(s) with the highest variance.

What is the percentage of variance explained by the first principal component?
message_2: To calculate the percentage of variance explained by the first principal component, we need the sales data matrix. Please provide the 8x5 sales data matrix.
